00031 /*
00032  * The disk API is used by both the QMT and QSD to access/update on-disk index
00033  * files. The API consists of the following functions:
00034  *
00035  * - lquota_disk_dir_find_create: look-up quota directory, create it if not
00036  *                                found.
00037  * - lquota_disk_glb_find_create: look-up global index file, create it if not
00038  *                                found.
00039  * - lquota_disk_slv_find:        look-up a slave index file.
00040  * - lquota_disk_slv_find_create: look-up a slave index file. Allocate a FID if
00041  *                                required and create the index file on disk if
00042  *                                it does not exist.
00043  * - lquota_disk_for_each_slv:    iterate over all existing slave index files
00044  * - lquota_disk_read:            read quota settings from an index file
00045  * - lquota_disk_declare_write:   reserve credits to update a record in an index
00046  *                                file
00047  * - lquota_disk_write:           update a record in an index file
00048  * - lquota_disk_update_ver:      update version of an index file
00049  */
00050 
00051 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LQUOTA
00052 
00053 #include "lquota_internal.h"
00054 
00055 #define LQUOTA_MODE (S_IFREG | S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR)
00056 
00057 /*
00058  * Helper function looking up & creating if not found an index file with a
00059  * dynamic fid.
00060  */
00061 static struct dt_object *
00062 lquota_disk_find_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *dev,
00063                         struct dt_object *parent, struct lu_fid *fid,
00064                         const struct dt_index_features *idx_feat,
00065                         char *name)
00066 {
00067         struct lquota_thread_info       *qti = lquota_info(env);
00068         struct dt_object                *obj;
00069         struct local_oid_storage        *los;
00070         int                              rc;
00071         ENTRY;
00072 
00073         /* Set up local storage */
00074         rc = local_oid_storage_init(env, dev, fid, &los);
00075         if (rc)
00076                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00077 
00078         /* lookup/create slave index file */
00079         obj = local_index_find_or_create(env, los, parent, name, LQUOTA_MODE,
00080                                          idx_feat);
00081         if (IS_ERR(obj))
00082                 GOTO(out, obj);
00083 
00084         /* local_oid_storage_fini() will finalize the local storage device,
00085          * we have to open the object in another device stack */
00086         qti->qti_fid = obj->do_lu.lo_header->loh_fid;
00087         lu_object_put_nocache(env, &obj->do_lu);
00088         obj = dt_locate(env, dev, &qti->qti_fid);
00089         if (IS_ERR(obj))
00090                 GOTO(out, obj);
00091 out:
00092         local_oid_storage_fini(env, los);
00093         RETURN(obj);
00094 }
00095 
00096 /*
00097  * helper function to generate the filename associated with a slave index file
00098  */
00099 static inline int lquota_disk_slv_filename(const struct lu_fid *glb_fid,
00100                                            struct obd_uuid *uuid,
00101                                            char *filename)
00102 {
00103         char    *name, *uuid_str;
00104 
00105         /* In most case, the uuid is NULL terminated */
00106         if (uuid->uuid[sizeof(*uuid) - 1] != '\0') {
00107                 OBD_ALLOC(uuid_str, sizeof(*uuid));
00108                 if (uuid_str == NULL)
00109                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00110                 memcpy(uuid_str, uuid->uuid, sizeof(*uuid) - 1);
00111         } else {
00112                 uuid_str = (char *)uuid->uuid;
00113         }
00114 
00115         /* we strip the slave's UUID (in the form of fsname-OST0001_UUID) of
00116          * the filesystem name in case this one is changed in the future */
00117         name = strrchr(uuid_str, '-');
00118         if (name == NULL) {
00119                 name = strrchr(uuid_str, ':');
00120                 if (name == NULL) {
00121                         CERROR("Failed to extract extract filesystem "
00122                                "name from UUID %s\n", uuid_str);
00123                         if (uuid_str != uuid->uuid)
00124                                 OBD_FREE(uuid_str, sizeof(*uuid));
00125                         return -EINVAL;
00126                 }
00127         }
00128         name++;
00129 
00130         /* the filename is composed of the most signicant bits of the global
00131          * FID, that's to say the oid which encodes the pool id, pool type and
00132          * quota type, followed by the export UUID */
00133         sprintf(filename, "0x%x-%s", glb_fid->f_oid, name);
00134 
00135         if (uuid_str != uuid->uuid)
00136                 OBD_FREE(uuid_str, sizeof(*uuid));
00137 
00138         return 0;
00139 }
00140 
00141 /*
00142  * Set up quota directory (either "quota_master" or "quota_slave") for a QMT or
00143  * QSD instance. This function is also used to create per-pool directory on
00144  * the quota master.
00145  * The directory is created with a local sequence if it does not exist already.
00146  * This function is called at ->ldo_prepare time when the full device stack is
00147  * configured.
00148  *
00149  * \param env  - is the environment passed by the caller
00150  * \param dev  - is the dt_device where to create the quota directory
00151  * \param parent  - is the parent directory. If not specified, the directory
00152  *                  will be created under the root directory
00153  * \param name - is the name of quota directory to be created
00154  *
00155  * \retval     - pointer to quota root dt_object on success, appropriate error
00156  *               on failure
00157  */
00158 struct dt_object *lquota_disk_dir_find_create(const struct lu_env *env,
00159                                               struct dt_device *dev,
00160                                               struct dt_object *parent,
00161                                               const char *name)
00162 {
00163         struct lquota_thread_info       *qti = lquota_info(env);
00164         struct dt_object                *qt_dir = NULL;
00165         struct local_oid_storage        *los = NULL;
00166         int                              rc;
00167         ENTRY;
00168 
00169         /* Set up local storage to create the quota directory.
00170          * We use the sequence reserved for local named objects */
00171         lu_local_name_obj_fid(&qti->qti_fid, 1);
00172         rc = local_oid_storage_init(env, dev, &qti->qti_fid, &los);
00173         if (rc)
00174                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00175 
00176         if (parent == NULL) {
00177                 /* Fetch dt object associated with root directory */
00178                 rc = dt_root_get(env, dev, &qti->qti_fid);
00179                 if (rc)
00180                         GOTO(out, rc);
00181 
00182                 parent = dt_locate_at(env, dev, &qti->qti_fid,
00183                                       dev->dd_lu_dev.ld_site->ls_top_dev, NULL);
00184                 if (IS_ERR(parent))
00185                         GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(parent));
00186         } else {
00187                 lu_object_get(&parent->do_lu);
00188         }
00189 
00190         /* create quota directory to be used for all quota index files */
00191         qt_dir = local_file_find_or_create(env, los, parent, name, S_IFDIR |
00192                                            S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR | S_IXUGO);
00193         if (IS_ERR(qt_dir))
00194                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(qt_dir));
00195 
00196         /* local_oid_storage_fini() will finalize the local storage device,
00197          * we have to open the object in another device stack */
00198         qti->qti_fid = qt_dir->do_lu.lo_header->loh_fid;
00199         lu_object_put_nocache(env, &qt_dir->do_lu);
00200         qt_dir = dt_locate(env, dev, &qti->qti_fid);
00201         if (IS_ERR(qt_dir))
00202                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(qt_dir));
00203 
00204         if (!dt_try_as_dir(env, qt_dir))
00205                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTDIR);
00206         EXIT;
00207 out:
00208         if (parent != NULL && !IS_ERR(parent))
00209                 lu_object_put(env, &parent->do_lu);
00210         if (los != NULL)
00211                 local_oid_storage_fini(env, los);
00212         if (rc) {
00213                 if (qt_dir != NULL && !IS_ERR(qt_dir))
00214                         lu_object_put(env, &qt_dir->do_lu);
00215                 qt_dir = ERR_PTR(rc);
00216         }
00217         return qt_dir;
00218 }
00219 
00220 /*
00221  * Look-up/create a global index file.
00222  *
00223  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00224  * \parap dev - is the dt_device where to lookup/create the global index file
00225  * \param parent - is the parent directory where to create the global index if
00226  *                 not found
00227  * \param fid - is the fid of the global index to be looked up/created
00228  * \parap local - indicates whether the index should be created with a local
00229  *                generated fid or with \fid
00230  *
00231  * \retval     - pointer to the dt_object of the global index on success,
00232  *               appropriate error on failure
00233  */
00234 struct dt_object *lquota_disk_glb_find_create(const struct lu_env *env,
00235                                               struct dt_device *dev,
00236                                               struct dt_object *parent,
00237                                               struct lu_fid *fid, bool local)
00238 {
00239         struct lquota_thread_info       *qti = lquota_info(env);
00240         struct dt_object                *glb_idx;
00241         const struct dt_index_features  *idx_feat;
00242         ENTRY;
00243 
00244         CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "look-up/create %sglobal idx file ("DFID")\n",
00245                local ? "local " : "", PFID(fid));
00246 
00247         idx_feat = &dt_quota_glb_features;
00248 
00249         /* the filename is composed of the most signicant bits of the FID,
00250          * that's to say the oid which encodes the pool id, pool type and quota
00251          * type */
00252         sprintf(qti->qti_buf, "0x%x", fid->f_oid);
00253 
00254         if (local) {
00255                 /* We use the sequence reserved for local named objects */
00256                 lu_local_name_obj_fid(&qti->qti_fid, 1);
00257                 glb_idx = lquota_disk_find_create(env, dev, parent,
00258                                                   &qti->qti_fid, idx_feat,
00259                                                   qti->qti_buf);
00260         } else {
00261                 /* look-up/create global index on disk */
00262                 glb_idx = local_index_find_or_create_with_fid(env, dev, fid,
00263                                                               parent,
00264                                                               qti->qti_buf,
00265                                                               LQUOTA_MODE,
00266                                                               idx_feat);
00267         }
00268 
00269         if (IS_ERR(glb_idx)) {
00270                 CERROR("%s: failed to look-up/create idx file "DFID" rc:%ld "
00271                        "local:%d\n", dev->dd_lu_dev.ld_obd->obd_name,
00272                        PFID(fid), PTR_ERR(glb_idx), local);
00273                 RETURN(glb_idx);
00274         }
00275 
00276         /* install index operation vector */
00277         if (glb_idx->do_index_ops == NULL) {
00278                 int rc;
00279 
00280                 rc = glb_idx->do_ops->do_index_try(env, glb_idx, idx_feat);
00281                 if (rc) {
00282                         CERROR("%s: failed to setup index operations for "DFID
00283                                " rc:%d\n", dev->dd_lu_dev.ld_obd->obd_name,
00284                                PFID(lu_object_fid(&glb_idx->do_lu)), rc);
00285                         lu_object_put(env, &glb_idx->do_lu);
00286                         glb_idx = ERR_PTR(rc);
00287                 }
00288         }
00289 
00290         RETURN(glb_idx);
00291 }
00292 
00293 /*
00294  * Look-up a slave index file.
00295  *
00296  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00297  * \param dev - is the backend dt_device where to look-up/create the slave index
00298  * \param parent - is the parent directory where to lookup the slave index
00299  * \param glb_fid - is the fid of the global index file associated with this
00300  *                  slave index.
00301  * \param uuid    - is the uuid of slave which is (re)connecting to the master
00302  *                  target
00303  *
00304  * \retval     - pointer to the dt_object of the slave index on success,
00305  *               appropriate error on failure
00306  */
00307 struct dt_object *lquota_disk_slv_find(const struct lu_env *env,
00308                                        struct dt_device *dev,
00309                                        struct dt_object *parent,
00310                                        const struct lu_fid *glb_fid,
00311                                        struct obd_uuid *uuid)
00312 {
00313         struct lquota_thread_info       *qti = lquota_info(env);
00314         struct dt_object                *slv_idx;
00315         int                              rc;
00316         ENTRY;
00317 
00318         LASSERT(uuid != NULL);
00319 
00320         CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "lookup slave index file for %s\n",
00321                obd_uuid2str(uuid));
00322 
00323         /* generate filename associated with the slave */
00324         rc = lquota_disk_slv_filename(glb_fid, uuid, qti->qti_buf);
00325         if (rc)
00326                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00327 
00328         /* lookup slave index file */
00329         rc = dt_lookup_dir(env, parent, qti->qti_buf, &qti->qti_fid);
00330         if (rc)
00331                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00332 
00333         /* name is found, get the object */
00334         slv_idx = dt_locate(env, dev, &qti->qti_fid);
00335         if (IS_ERR(slv_idx))
00336                 RETURN(slv_idx);
00337 
00338         if (slv_idx->do_index_ops == NULL) {
00339                 rc = slv_idx->do_ops->do_index_try(env, slv_idx,
00340                                                    &dt_quota_slv_features);
00341                 if (rc) {
00342                         CERROR("%s: failed to setup slave index operations for "
00343                                "%s, rc:%d\n", dev->dd_lu_dev.ld_obd->obd_name,
00344                                obd_uuid2str(uuid), rc);
00345                         lu_object_put(env, &slv_idx->do_lu);
00346                         slv_idx = ERR_PTR(rc);
00347                 }
00348         }
00349 
00350         RETURN(slv_idx);
00351 }
00352 
00353 /*
00354  * Look-up a slave index file. If the slave index isn't found:
00355  * - if local is set to false, we allocate a FID from FID_SEQ_QUOTA sequence and
00356  *   create the index.
00357  * - otherwise, we create the index file with a local reserved FID (see
00358  *   lquota_local_oid)
00359  *
00360  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00361  * \param dev - is the backend dt_device where to look-up/create the slave index
00362  * \param parent - is the parent directory where to create the slave index if
00363  *                 it does not exist already
00364  * \param glb_fid - is the fid of the global index file associated with this
00365  *                  slave index.
00366  * \param uuid    - is the uuid of slave which is (re)connecting to the master
00367  *                  target
00368  * \param local   - indicate whether to use local reserved FID (LQUOTA_USR_OID
00369  *                  & LQUOTA_GRP_OID) for the slave index creation or to
00370  *                  allocate a new fid from sequence FID_SEQ_QUOTA
00371  *
00372  * \retval     - pointer to the dt_object of the slave index on success,
00373  *               appropriate error on failure
00374  */
00375 struct dt_object *lquota_disk_slv_find_create(const struct lu_env *env,
00376                                               struct dt_device *dev,
00377                                               struct dt_object *parent,
00378                                               struct lu_fid *glb_fid,
00379                                               struct obd_uuid *uuid,
00380                                               bool local)
00381 {
00382         struct lquota_thread_info       *qti = lquota_info(env);
00383         struct dt_object                *slv_idx;
00384         int                              rc;
00385         ENTRY;
00386 
00387         LASSERT(uuid != NULL);
00388 
00389         CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "lookup/create slave index file for %s\n",
00390                obd_uuid2str(uuid));
00391 
00392         /* generate filename associated with the slave */
00393         rc = lquota_disk_slv_filename(glb_fid, uuid, qti->qti_buf);
00394         if (rc)
00395                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00396 
00397         /* Slave indexes uses the FID_SEQ_QUOTA sequence since they can be read
00398          * through the network */
00399         qti->qti_fid.f_seq = FID_SEQ_QUOTA;
00400         qti->qti_fid.f_ver = 0;
00401         if (local) {
00402                 int type;
00403 
00404                 rc = lquota_extract_fid(glb_fid, NULL, NULL, &type);
00405                 if (rc)
00406                         RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00407 
00408                 /* use predefined fid in the reserved oid list */
00409                 qti->qti_fid.f_oid = (type == USRQUOTA) ? LQUOTA_USR_OID
00410                                                         : LQUOTA_GRP_OID;
00411 
00412                 slv_idx = local_index_find_or_create_with_fid(env, dev,
00413                                                               &qti->qti_fid,
00414                                                               parent,
00415                                                               qti->qti_buf,
00416                                                               LQUOTA_MODE,
00417                                                         &dt_quota_slv_features);
00418         } else {
00419                 /* allocate fid dynamically if index does not exist already */
00420                 qti->qti_fid.f_oid = LQUOTA_GENERATED_OID;
00421 
00422                 /* lookup/create slave index file */
00423                 slv_idx = lquota_disk_find_create(env, dev, parent,
00424                                                   &qti->qti_fid,
00425                                                   &dt_quota_slv_features,
00426                                                   qti->qti_buf);
00427         }
00428 
00429         if (IS_ERR(slv_idx))
00430                 RETURN(slv_idx);
00431 
00432         /* install index operation vector */
00433         if (slv_idx->do_index_ops == NULL) {
00434                 rc = slv_idx->do_ops->do_index_try(env, slv_idx,
00435                                                    &dt_quota_slv_features);
00436                 if (rc) {
00437                         CERROR("%s: failed to setup index operations for "DFID
00438                                " rc:%d\n", dev->dd_lu_dev.ld_obd->obd_name,
00439                                PFID(lu_object_fid(&slv_idx->do_lu)), rc);
00440                         lu_object_put(env, &slv_idx->do_lu);
00441                         slv_idx = ERR_PTR(rc);
00442                 }
00443         }
00444 
00445         RETURN(slv_idx);
00446 }
00447 
00448 /*
00449  * Iterate over all slave index files associated with global index \glb_fid and
00450  * invoke a callback function for each slave index file.
00451  *
00452  * \param env     - is the environment passed by the caller
00453  * \param parent  - is the parent directory where the slave index files are
00454  *                  stored
00455  * \param glb_fid - is the fid of the global index file associated with the
00456  *                  slave indexes to scan
00457  * \param func    - is the callback function to call each time a slave index
00458  *                  file is found
00459  * \param arg     - is an opaq argument passed to the callback function \func
00460  */
00461 int lquota_disk_for_each_slv(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *parent,
00462                              struct lu_fid *glb_fid, lquota_disk_slv_cb_t func,
00463                              void *arg)
00464 {
00465         struct lquota_thread_info       *qti = lquota_info(env);
00466         struct dt_it                    *it;
00467         const struct dt_it_ops          *iops;
00468         char                            *name;
00469         int                              rc;
00470         ENTRY;
00471 
00472         OBD_ALLOC(name, LQUOTA_NAME_MAX);
00473         if (name == NULL)
00474                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00475 
00476         /* filename associated with slave index files are prefixed with the most
00477          * signicant bits of the global FID */
00478         sprintf(name, "0x%x-", glb_fid->f_oid);
00479 
00480         iops = &parent->do_index_ops->dio_it;
00481         it = iops->init(env, parent, 0);
00482         if (IS_ERR(it)) {
00483                 OBD_FREE(name, LQUOTA_NAME_MAX);
00484                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(it));
00485         }
00486 
00487         rc = iops->load(env, it, 0);
00488         if (rc == 0) {
00489                 /*
00490                  * Iterator didn't find record with exactly the key requested.
00491                  *
00492                  * It is currently either
00493                  *
00494                  *     - positioned above record with key less than
00495                  *     requested---skip it.
00496                  *
00497                  *     - or not positioned at all (is in IAM_IT_SKEWED
00498                  *     state)---position it on the next item.
00499                  */
00500                 rc = iops->next(env, it);
00501         } else if (rc > 0)
00502                 rc = 0;
00503 
00504         while (rc == 0) {
00505                 struct dt_key   *key;
00506                 int              len;
00507 
00508                 len = iops->key_size(env, it);
00509                 /* IAM iterator can return record with zero len. */
00510                 if (len == 0 || len <= strlen(name) || len >= LQUOTA_NAME_MAX)
00511                         goto next;
00512 
00513                 key = iops->key(env, it);
00514                 if (IS_ERR(key)) {
00515                         rc = PTR_ERR(key);
00516                         break;
00517                 }
00518 
00519                 if (strncmp((char *)key, name, strlen(name)) != 0)
00520                         goto next;
00521 
00522                 /* ldiskfs OSD returns filename as stored in directory entry
00523                  * which does not end up with '\0' */
00524                 memcpy(&qti->qti_buf, key, len);
00525                 qti->qti_buf[len] = '\0';
00526 
00527                 /* lookup fid associated with this slave index file */
00528                 rc = dt_lookup_dir(env, parent, qti->qti_buf, &qti->qti_fid);
00529                 if (rc)
00530                         break;
00531 
00532                 if (qti->qti_fid.f_seq != FID_SEQ_QUOTA)
00533                         goto next;
00534 
00535                 rc = func(env, glb_fid, (char *)key, &qti->qti_fid, arg);
00536                 if (rc)
00537                         break;
00538 next:
00539                 do {
00540                         rc = iops->next(env, it);
00541                 } while (rc == -ESTALE);
00542         }
00543 
00544         iops->put(env, it);
00545         iops->fini(env, it);
00546         OBD_FREE(name, LQUOTA_NAME_MAX);
00547         if (rc > 0)
00548                 rc = 0;
00549         RETURN(rc);
00550 }
00551 
00552 /*
00553  * Retrieve quota settings from disk for a particular identifier.
00554  *
00555  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00556  * \param obj - is the on-disk index where quota settings are stored.
00557  * \param id  - is the key to be updated
00558  * \param rec - is the output record where to store quota settings.
00559  *
00560  * \retval    - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00561  */
00562 int lquota_disk_read(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *obj,
00563                      union lquota_id *id, struct dt_rec *rec)
00564 {
00565         int     rc;
00566         ENTRY;
00567 
00568         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(obj));
00569         LASSERT(obj->do_index_ops != NULL);
00570 
00571         /* lookup on-disk record from index file */
00572         dt_read_lock(env, obj, 0);
00573         rc = dt_lookup(env, obj, rec, (struct dt_key *)&id->qid_uid);
00574         dt_read_unlock(env, obj);
00575 
00576         RETURN(rc);
00577 }
00578 
00579 /*
00580  * Reserve enough credits to update a record in a quota index file.
00581  *
00582  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00583  * \param th  - is the transaction to use for disk writes
00584  * \param obj - is the on-disk index where quota settings are stored.
00585  * \param id  - is the key to be updated
00586  *
00587  * \retval    - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00588  */
00589 int lquota_disk_declare_write(const struct lu_env *env, struct thandle *th,
00590                               struct dt_object *obj, union lquota_id *id)
00591 {
00592         struct lquota_thread_info       *qti = lquota_info(env);
00593         struct dt_key                   *key = (struct dt_key *)&id->qid_uid;
00594         int                              rc;
00595         ENTRY;
00596 
00597         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(obj));
00598         LASSERT(obj->do_index_ops != NULL);
00599 
00600         /* speculative delete declaration in case there is already an existing
00601          * record in the index */
00602         rc = dt_declare_delete(env, obj, key, th);
00603         if (rc)
00604                 RETURN(rc);
00605 
00606         /* declare insertion of updated record */
00607         rc = dt_declare_insert(env, obj, (struct dt_rec *)&qti->qti_rec, key,
00608                                th);
00609         if (rc)
00610                 RETURN(rc);
00611 
00612         /* we might have to update the version of the global index too */
00613         rc = dt_declare_version_set(env, obj, th);
00614 
00615         RETURN(rc);
00616 }
00617 
00618 /*
00619  * Update a record in a quota index file.
00620  *
00621  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00622  * \param th  - is the transaction to use for disk writes
00623  * \param obj - is the on-disk index to be updated.
00624  * \param id  - is the key to be updated
00625  * \param rec - is the input record containing the new quota settings.
00626  * \param flags - can be LQUOTA_BUMP_VER or LQUOTA_SET_VER.
00627  * \param ver   - is the new version of the index if LQUOTA_SET_VER is set or is
00628  *                used to return the new version of the index when
00629  *                LQUOTA_BUMP_VER is set.
00630  *
00631  * \retval    - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00632  */
00633 int lquota_disk_write(const struct lu_env *env, struct thandle *th,
00634                       struct dt_object *obj, union lquota_id *id,
00635                       struct dt_rec *rec, __u32 flags, __u64 *ver)
00636 {
00637         struct lquota_thread_info       *qti = lquota_info(env);
00638         struct dt_key                   *key = (struct dt_key *)&id->qid_uid;
00639         int                              rc;
00640         ENTRY;
00641 
00642         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(obj));
00643         LASSERT(obj->do_index_ops != NULL);
00644 
00645         /* lock index */
00646         dt_write_lock(env, obj, 0);
00647 
00648         /* check whether there is already an existing record for this ID */
00649         rc = dt_lookup(env, obj, (struct dt_rec *)&qti->qti_rec, key);
00650         if (rc == 0) {
00651                 /* delete existing record in order to replace it */
00652                 rc = dt_delete(env, obj, key, th);
00653                 if (rc)
00654                         GOTO(out, rc);
00655         } else if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00656                 /* probably first insert */
00657                 rc = 0;
00658         } else {
00659                 GOTO(out, rc);
00660         }
00661 
00662         if (rec != NULL) {
00663                 /* insert record with updated quota settings */
00664                 rc = dt_insert(env, obj, rec, key, th, 1);
00665                 if (rc) {
00666                         /* try to insert the old one */
00667                         rc = dt_insert(env, obj, (struct dt_rec *)&qti->qti_rec,
00668                                        key, th, 1);
00669                         LASSERTF(rc == 0, "failed to insert record in quota "
00670                                  "index "DFID"\n",
00671                                  PFID(lu_object_fid(&obj->do_lu)));
00672                         GOTO(out, rc);
00673                 }
00674         }
00675 
00676         if (flags != 0) {
00677                 LASSERT(ver);
00678                 if (flags & LQUOTA_BUMP_VER) {
00679                         /* caller wants to bump the version, let's first read
00680                          * it */
00681                         *ver = dt_version_get(env, obj);
00682                         (*ver)++;
00683                 } else {
00684                         LASSERT(flags & LQUOTA_SET_VER);
00685                 }
00686                 dt_version_set(env, obj, *ver, th);
00687         }
00688 
00689         EXIT;
00690 out:
00691         dt_write_unlock(env, obj);
00692         return rc;
00693 }
00694 
00695 /*
00696  * Update version of an index file
00697  *
00698  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00699  * \param dev - is the backend dt device storing the index file
00700  * \param obj - is the on-disk index that should be updated
00701  * \param ver - is the new version
00702  */
00703 int lquota_disk_update_ver(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *dev,
00704                            struct dt_object *obj, __u64 ver)
00705 {
00706         struct thandle  *th;
00707         int              rc;
00708         ENTRY;
00709 
00710         th = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
00711         if (IS_ERR(th))
00712                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(th));
00713 
00714         rc = dt_declare_version_set(env, obj, th);
00715         if (rc)
00716                 GOTO(out, rc);
00717 
00718         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, th);
00719         if (rc)
00720                 GOTO(out, rc);
00721         th->th_sync = 1;
00722 
00723         dt_version_set(env, obj, ver, th);
00724         EXIT;
00725 out:
00726         dt_trans_stop(env, dev, th);
00727         return rc;
00728 }
00729 
00730 /*
00731  * Write a global record
00732  *
00733  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00734  * \param obj - is the on-disk global index to be updated
00735  * \param id  - index to be updated
00736  * \param rec - record to be written
00737  */
00738 int lquota_disk_write_glb(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *obj,
00739                           __u64 id, struct lquota_glb_rec *rec)
00740 {
00741         struct dt_device        *dev = lu2dt_dev(obj->do_lu.lo_dev);
00742         struct thandle          *th;
00743         struct dt_key           *key = (struct dt_key *)&id;
00744         int                      rc;
00745         ENTRY;
00746 
00747         th = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
00748         if (IS_ERR(th))
00749                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(th));
00750 
00751         /* the entry with 0 key can always be found in IAM file. */
00752         if (id == 0) {
00753                 rc = dt_declare_delete(env, obj, key, th);
00754                 if (rc)
00755                         GOTO(out, rc);
00756         }
00757 
00758         rc = dt_declare_insert(env, obj, (struct dt_rec *)rec, key, th);
00759         if (rc)
00760                 GOTO(out, rc);
00761 
00762         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, th);
00763         if (rc)
00764                 GOTO(out, rc);
00765 
00766         dt_write_lock(env, obj, 0);
00767 
00768         if (id == 0) {
00769                 struct lquota_glb_rec *tmp;
00770 
00771                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(tmp);
00772                 if (tmp == NULL)
00773                         GOTO(out_lock, rc = -ENOMEM);
00774 
00775                 rc = dt_lookup(env, obj, (struct dt_rec *)tmp, key);
00776 
00777                 OBD_FREE_PTR(tmp);
00778                 if (rc == 0) {
00779                         rc = dt_delete(env, obj, key, th);
00780                         if (rc)
00781                                 GOTO(out_lock, rc);
00782                 }
00783                 rc = 0;
00784         }
00785 
00786         rc = dt_insert(env, obj, (struct dt_rec *)rec, key, th, 1);
00787 out_lock:
00788         dt_write_unlock(env, obj);
00789 out:
00790         dt_trans_stop(env, dev, th);
00791         RETURN(rc);
00792 }
